page.title: 08Farming - continued
page.content: of poplar trees, which when felled in 20 - 30 years time will be used for matches. The dairy herd consists of 80 pedigree Friesian cows together with 40 youngstock. During the summer they graze the grass and in the winter they live in straw yards and feed on silage and hay made from the grass in the summer. They also eat dairy nuts purchased from a local merchant. The cows and youngstock are looked after by one man who milks the cows by machine in a herringbone parlour. The milk is then cooled and collected by a tanker lorry and goes to the dairy in Flitwick. The beef herd - consists of around 900 animals, mostly Friesian bulls, which live in strawed yards. Theyt are purchased from Devon at l2 weeks of age and fed on barley (all home grown plus purchased. when insufficient is
